journey.title: The Journey
journey.p1: I'm Felipe Triana Castañeda, a Colombian software engineer who found a home in Berlin. My journey in tech started in Bogotá, where I earned my Systems and Computing Engineering degree from Universidad de los Andes with a thesis on AI-powered skin disease detection using ontologies.
journey.p2: Over the past 12+ years, I've built distributed systems serving hundreds of millions of users at companies like eBay, Zalando, and Prodigious. What drives me is the intersection of scale, architecture, and innovation—especially now with AI transforming how we build software.
journey.p3: Today, I'm a Staff Software Engineer at eBay, where I lead technical projects from design to delivery and extensively leverage AI tools (Claude, ChatGPT, GitHub Copilot) for 75%+ of my daily workflow. I'm passionate about functional programming, system scalability, and making AI work in production.

beyond.title: Beyond the Code
beyond.p1: Music is my second language. In 2025, I founded Cumbé, a traditional gaita music ensemble from the Montes de María in Berlin. We play gaita (Colombian flute) and percussion, bridging my Colombian heritage with Berlin's diverse music scene. I also study bandola llanera, the string instrument from the Eastern Plains used to play joropo.

cumbe.title: Cumbé
cumbe.subtitle: Colombian Traditional Music Ensemble · Berlin, Germany
cumbe.description: Founded in 2025, Cumbé is my passion project that brings the rich sounds of traditional gaita music from the Montes de María to Berlin's diverse cultural landscape. We explore the rhythms and melodies of Colombia's Caribbean coast, with gaita hembra, gaita macho, llamador, tambor alegre, and tambora.

gaita.title: Gaita
gaita.description: Traditional Colombian flute from the coastal regions. A beautiful wind instrument with a haunting, melodic quality that's central to cumbia and other Colombian rhythms.

bandola.title: Bandola Llanera
bandola.description: String instrument from the Eastern Plains (Llanos Orientales). Part of the lute family, it produces bright, resonant tones perfect for joropo. Currently studying this beautiful instrument of llanera music.

percussion.title: Percussion
percussion.description: Llamador, tambor alegre, and tambora are fundamental to gaita music. These drums of African origin provide the rhythm and energy for cumbias, porros, and puyas from the Montes de María.

harmony.title: Music Harmony
harmony.description: Currently studying music theory and harmony to deepen my understanding of composition, arrangement, and the theoretical foundations of traditional Colombian music.
